newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Court dismisses appeal by Guerin cars against Commission.
newsitem.headline: Court dismisses appeal by Guerin cars against Commission.

text.p: The European Court of Justice dismissed on Tuesday an appeal brought by Guerin Automobiles against the European Commission's decision not to pursue Volvo France for alleged competition violations.
The Commission decided Volvo's termination of a dealership contract with Guerin was not an issue involving Community interests.

The Commission said Volvo's refusal to sell cars to Guerin under a network of exclusive and selective distribution contracts was outside the scope of Commission regulations applying competition rules to car distribution.
The Court of First Instance threw Guerin's challenge out as inadmissible, and the court today found no reason to overturn that decision.

"It must also be noted that any undertaking which considers that it has suffered damage as a result of restrictive practices may rely before the national courts, particularly where the Commission decides not to act on a complaint, on the rights conferred on it by article 85(1) and article 85 of the Treaty, which produce direct effect in relations between individuals," the court said.
(Court translation into English. Original language of the case: French)
